title: Bacterial Meningitis: Clinical Overview and Epidemiology
short_description: Clinical document providing comprehensive information about bacterial meningitis, including symptoms, epidemiology, and diagnostic approaches.
long_description: This clinical reference document presents a detailed overview of bacterial meningitis, a serious central nervous system infection characterized by inflammation of the meninges surrounding the brain and spinal cord. The document covers key clinical manifestations including fever, headache, and neck stiffness, along with comprehensive epidemiological data showing that approximately 2,600 cases occur annually in the United States. It provides age-specific risk factors, noting that 70% of cases occur in children under 5 years old, with detailed breakdowns of different bacterial causes including pneumococcal infections, Haemophilus influenzae, and group B streptococcus. The document also outlines diagnostic approaches including cerebrospinal fluid examination, imaging techniques, and laboratory testing methods used for confirmation.
